title: Kill.exe Not Found
info: Kill.exe Not Found is my entry to JS13k, which is a competition to create a JavaScript/HTML5 game in under 13kb. The theme was 404, interpreted as 'not found'.
You play as a defense robot during an alien invasion. Your kill.exe file is missing so the only way to get rid of the aliens is to give them what they want: food!

title: Invasion!
info: Invasion! is a game about my dog Penny, dreaming of battling squirrels in space.
It is a Single Page Application made with vanilla JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and a custom Rails API.
The objective is to defeat as many squirrels as possible and add your high score to the leaderboard.

title: Hoo's There?
info: Hoo's There? is a companion app for Animal Crossing: New Horizons that allows the user to keep track of the creatures they've caught and displays which creatures are currently available to catch based on the date and time.
I wrote a scraper using Nokogiri to gather the information I needed and used Thunk middleware for Redux to make asynchronous calls to fetch that data from my custom Rails API.
keywords: React, Redux, Rails, Ruby, JavaScript, ActiveRecord

title: GameTracker v.1
info: GameTracker is a video game collection app made with Ruby and Sinatra.
The user can create an account and add games to their personal library by adding custom games or searching, which utilizes the IGDB API for the most current and accurate game data.

title: GameTracker v.2
info: GameTracker v.2 is an overhauled version of my video game collection app, GameTracker v.1, this time made with Ruby on Rails.

This version allows for users to sign up by username/email or Google login via OAuth 2.0 and add games to their personal library. Each game can be marked as 'want to play', 'currently playing', or 'completed', and the user can add as many notes/objectives to a game as they want.

title: Dungeon Dino
info: Dungeon Dino is a game I made for the Pico-8 fantasy console. It's written in Lua and I made all the sprites and sounds in the Pico-8.
You play as Dungeon Dino, and your objective is to find as many gems as you can in a room. The catch is that you have to smash vases to find the gems, and some vases contain explosives.
My goal when creating this game was to learn some concepts of game development while figuring out the Pico-8. Therefore it's not exactly an exciting game (though I'm pretty excited about it).
